page.title: 16 BICTON AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE
page.content: Bicton College occupies the fine house & estate but not the gardens.It has been Devon's College of Agriculture since 1946,first leased then purchased. Students are taken mainly from Devon & Cornwall onto a wide range of full & part-time courses,making 490 full-time equivalent places.Some of the main teaching is for the 3year National Diploma-Agriculture & the 1yr National Cert. in Ag.Other courses include Farm Secretarial,Horticulture & Rural Craft & Husbandry.In order to provide practical experience,Bicton Home Farm & other land at Woodbury & Farringdon(228 ha.in all) is owned & rented.On the Grade 1 red sandy soils,the major crop is grass for grazing & fodder;cropping yields potatoes,cereals & other feed- stuffs.150 Friesian cows,60 sows,200 ewes & poultry are kept for teaching & also give milk,beef,bacon & lambs.
